flavorText: They feared each other for their differences but were absolutely terrified at their similarities.

foreignData.flavorText: Sie fürchteten sich vor ihren Unterschieden und erschraken über ihre Ähnlichkeit.
foreignData.name: Doppelte Verneinung
foreignData.text: Neutralisiere bis zu zwei Zaubersprüche deiner Wahl.

foreignData.flavorText: Se temían mutuamente por sus diferencias, pero estaban absolutamente aterrorizados de sus semejanzas.
foreignData.name: Doble negativo

foreignData.flavorText: Ils se craignaient l'un de l'autre à cause de leurs différences, mais étaient absolument terrifiés par leur similitudes.
foreignData.name: Double négative

foreignData.flavorText: Si temevano l'un l'altro per le loro diversità, ma erano ancor più terrorizzati dalle loro somiglianze.
foreignData.name: Raddoppiare il Negativo
foreignData.text: Neutralizza fino a due magie bersaglio.

foreignData.flavorText: 彼らは互いの違いに恐れを抱いたが、その一方で自分達の相似性に決定的な恐怖を感じていた。
foreignData.name: 二重否定
foreignData.text: 最大２つまでの呪文を対象とし、それらを打ち消す。

foreignData.flavorText: Eles temiam um ao outro pelas suas diferenças, mas estavam absolutamente aterrorizados com suas semelhanças.
foreignData.name: Negativo Duplo

foreignData.flavorText: Они страшились своих различий, но сходства пугали их еще больше.
foreignData.name: Двойное Отрицание
foreignData.text: Отмените не более двух целевых заклинаний.

foreignData.flavorText: 他们为彼此的差异而互相恐惧，但更被彼此的相似而给彻底吓坏。
foreignData.name: 双重否定
foreignData.text: 反击至多两个目标咒语。

name: Double Negative
originalText: Counter up to two target spells.

rulings.text: You may cast Double Negative with no targets, one target, or two targets.

In order to counter two target spells, both of those spells must be on the stack at the time you cast Double Negative. Two spells can be on the stack at the same time as the result of an ability (such as cascade or replicate), as the result of a copy effect (such as the one from Cloven Casting or Twincast), or because a spell has been cast in response to another spell.

It’s unusual for a player to cast a spell in response to their own spell, and that will be specifically called out when it happens. Under normal circumstances, if a player casts a spell, it is assumed that the player passes priority afterward. If that player casts another spell, it is assumed that each other player has also passed priority, which caused the first spell to resolve and the first player to receive priority again. Unless the first player says otherwise, only one spell will be on the stack at a time in that scenario.

text: Counter up to two target spells.
